intro: Ouratea lunzuensis, commonly known as the Lanzhou ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are often fragrant, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release minute seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
